channel.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
channel.description:
Ah yes the joys of not having a gaming rig.
However I found the Black Mesa played very well on my first time through when I recorded around 7,000 screenshots.
So I felt that I'd do a commentary free Let's Play so people could see how it ran on the lower end of the spectrum. Starting in the 4th video I'll be backing off the Particles some other than that though everything else will be on high.
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e1j3qEZv9SI']https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e1j3qEZv9SI[/url]
I chose to play the game as if I were a scientist living out the events for the first time. I nod and shake my head often and try and convey silent panic when things inevitably go wrong.
I hope you check it out.
Cheers!

item.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
item.dc:creator: RossBondReturns
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

Hey no fair, I had similar framerates but your credits scrolled a lot faster than mine.

Honestly, when I beat it the credits songs ended halfway through and I sat through the rest in silence expecting something interesting at the end to make up for the wait. [It didn’t.]

It actually runs quite surprisingly well when I’m not recording…you can see the difference by watching the Let’s Play BM SE link above.

Read full topic

item.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
item.dc:creator: RossBondReturns
item.description:
Alright…so I’ve finished with my Let’s Play of Black Mesa, as I’m typing this the last segment is uploading making it a 36 part collection.

I’d like to thank those who encouraged me to stick it out because it was worth it. Sometime later I will be doing a second LP of Black Mesa for PlanetPhillips The Replay Experience Experiment. Hopefully I’ll have a place where I can record good audio- regardless since my laptop didn’t explode I’ll be doing my second LP of Black Mesa on Normal.

Here’s the remainder of the links-

Forget about Freeman!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CKyG1zJoZ30 Part One
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ArHehGpV65M Part Two
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iMN-JfyVUDo Part Three

Lambda Core

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ajRlSKccK3U Part One
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ArwJBw0OdSE Part Two
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2C_wwp3y7wI Part Three
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bPuhEGuKCdU Part Four

Once again thanks for watching!

I made my first playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKz-ykbqQNjEX4VtLA83W95HS34Jzd9co&feature=view_all Let’s Play Black Mesa

Read full topic

item.source: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!

item.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
item.dc:creator: RossBondReturns
item.description:
Alright folks we’ve hit Surface Tension and as I knew would happen I had a LOT of framerate issues. This did not come as a surprise at all, as I’ve said before it runs great when I’m not recording. Surface Tension is also the very reason why I chose to do this LP on Easy mode because if I hadn’t I’d have died a few billion times over by now.

So here’s the word of warning: These HAVE been edited to remove 5-10-15 seconds gaps of frozen movement and sound fx. In other words when the action gets frenetic (like especially fighting the tank) it will get choppy. I didn’t do a beauty pass on my cuts, I just made it smoother.

That said here’s the first two parts:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_-iFneFgCi8 Part One
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J6EzFFjzmFg Part Two

Read full topic
item.source: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!

item.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
item.dc:creator: RossBondReturns
item.description:
Jokerine:

Ah, remember when I used to own a Presario. That was like 10 years ago…

I do it simply because it’s all I can afford to do.

Of course when I’m not recording for LP’s Black Mesa runs really well- when I’m done with the LP I’m going to go through with everything full maxed simply to get the full game screenshotted as nice as it can look.

Also-

Questionable Ethics
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BchspaI18EA Part One
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OZyBkblGwHI Part Two

Read full topic

item.source: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!

item.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
item.dc:creator: RossBondReturns
item.description:
Just thought I’d mention that having just recorded the footage for Part 4 Unforeseen Consequences- I had to back thing down to Medium for this part because as much as I tried and I did try four times to play it on High Settings…the recording was just too stutter y.

I’ll switch thing back up to High and test things out for the next section…mostly though I want the experience to look good for the viewer but more importantly play well enough so that I survive.

We’ll see how it goes.

By the end of the day we’ll see but I don’t think I’ll have uploaded all of Unforeseen Consequences. (Since I have only a slow connection at home I can only upload while I’m at the library or coffee shop ordinarily).

Hope you enjoy!

By the end of today we’ll be through Unforeseen Consequences. I’ll also try and make sure all the videos are linked up.

Read full topic
item.source: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!

item.title: I Let's Play Black Mesa On my Compaq Presario!
item.dc:creator: GalaxySwift
item.description:
RossBondReturns:

I chose to play the game as if I were a scientist living out the events for the first time. I nod and shake my head often and try and convey silent panic when things inevitably go wrong.

I hope you check it out.

Cheers!

Heh, I like doing that even if I’m not recording.
But yeah, it’d be interesting seeing how this plays on a low-end machine that’s recording at the same time. Watching the video now.

Read full topic
